name: py-pygmt

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: A Python interface for the Generic Mapping Tools.

dependencies.name: gmt
dependencies.description:
GMT (Generic Mapping Tools) is an open source collection of about 80
command-line tools for manipulating geographic and Cartesian data sets
(including filtering, trend fitting, gridding, projecting, etc.) and
producing PostScript illustrations ranging from simple x-y plots via
contour maps to artificially illuminated surfaces and 3D perspective
views.

dependencies.name: py-netcdf4
dependencies.description: Python interface to the netCDF Library.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm
dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.

dependencies.name: py-xarray
dependencies.description: N-D labeled arrays and datasets in Python

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependent_to.name: neic-finitefault
dependent_to.description:
Wavelet and simulated Annealing SliP inversion (WASP). This code uses a
nonlinear simulated annealing inversion method to model slip amplitude,
rake, rupture time, and rise time on a discretized fault plane, finding
the solution that best fits the observations in the wavelet domain.
